title: Boy stable after accidental shooting
content:
FAIRBANKS — A 9-year-old Delta Junction boy was in stable condition Thursday after his older brother unintentionally shot him with a rife a day earlier, according to Alaska State Troopers.
The incident involving a .22-caliber rifle happened Wednesday afternoon inside a residence. The other boy is 15.
“The 15-year-old was handling the firearm and it was unintentionally discharged,” troopers spokeswoman Megan Peters said in an e-mail.
The older boy immediately called for help, Peters said. The incident was reported at about 4:30 p.m.
The 9-year-old boy was taken to Fairbanks Memorial Hospital by ground transportation, Peters said. Injuries are reportedly not -life-threatening.
Peters said no adults were inside the residence at the time of the incident.
Contact the newsroom at 459-7572.
